TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit RegexMatchTimeoutException extends System.TimeoutException implements class System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable

Docs.summary: The exception that is thrown when the execution time of a regular expression pattern-matching method exceeds its time-out interval.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The presence of a <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexMatchTimeoutException> exception generally indicates one of the following conditions:
- The regular expression engine is backtracking excessively as it attempts to match the input text to the regular expression pattern.
- The time-out interval has been set too low, especially given high machine load.
The way in which an exception handler handles an exception depends on the cause of the exception:
- If the time-out results from excessive backtracking, your exception handler should abandon the attempt to match the input and inform the user that a time-out has occurred in the regular expression pattern-matching method. If possible, information about the regular expression pattern, which is available from the <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexMatchTimeoutException.Pattern%2A> property, and the input that caused excessive backtracking, which is available from the <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexMatchTimeoutException.Input%2A> property, should be logged so that the issue can be investigated and the regular expression pattern modified. Time-outs due to excessive backtracking are always reproducible.
- If the time-out results from setting the time-out threshold too low, you can increase the time-out interval and retry the matching operation. The current time-out interval is available from the <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexMatchTimeoutException.MatchTimeout%2A> property. When a <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexMatchTimeoutException> exception is thrown, the regular expression engine maintains its state so that any future invocations return the same result, as if the exception did not occur. The recommended pattern is to wait for a brief, random time interval after the exception is thrown before calling the matching method again. This can be repeated several times. However, the number of repetitions should be small in case the time-out is caused by excessive backtracking.
The example in the next section illustrates both techniques for handling a <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexMatchTimeoutException>.
## Examples The following example illustrates two possible approaches to handling the <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexMatchTimeoutException> exception. A constant whose value is two seconds defines the maximum time-out interval. The <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex.IsMatch%28System.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexOptions%2CSystem.TimeSpan%29?displayProperty=fullName> method is initially called with a time-out interval of one second. Each <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexMatchTimeoutException> exception causes the time-out interval to be increased by one second and results in another call to the <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex.IsMatch%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method if the current time-out interval is less than the maximum time-out interval. However, if the current time-out interval exceeds the maximum time-out interval, the exception handler writes information to the event log and abandons the processing of the regular expression.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a system-supplied message.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is the default constructor of the <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexMatchTimeoutException> class. This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error. This message is localized for the current system culture.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message) cil managed

Docs.param: A string that describes the exception.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified message string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `message` string is assigned to the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property. The string should be localized for the current culture.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo info, valuetype System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: The object that contains the serialized data.
The stream that contains the serialized data.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with serialized data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor is not called directly by your code to instantiate the <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexMatchTimeoutException> object. Instead, it is called by the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.IFormatter.Deserialize%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method when deserializing the <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexMatchTimeoutException> object from a stream.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string message, class System.Exception inner) cil managed

Docs.param: A string that describes the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Typically, you use this overload to handle an exception in a `try/catch` block. The `innerException` parameter should be a reference to the exception object handled in the `catch` block, or it can be `null`. This value is then assigned to the <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexMatchTimeoutException> object's <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
The `message` string is assigned to the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property. The string should be localized for the current culture.

MemberSignature.Value: public RegexMatchTimeoutException (string regexInput, string regexPattern, TimeSpan matchTimeout);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string regexInput, string regexPattern, valuetype System.TimeSpan matchTimeout) cil managed

Docs.param: The input text processed by the regular expression engine when the time-out occurred.
The pattern used by the regular expression engine when the time-out occurred.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with information about the regular expression pattern, the input text, and the time-out interval.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `regexInput`, `regexPattern`, and `matchTimeout` values are assigned to the <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexMatchTimeoutException.Input%2A>, <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexMatchTimeoutException.Pattern%2A>, and <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexMatchTimeoutException.MatchTimeout%2A> properties of the new <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexMatchTimeoutException> object.

Docs.summary: Gets the input text that the regular expression engine was processing when the time-out occurred.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property reflects the value of the `regexInput` parameter of the <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexMatchTimeoutException.%23ctor%28System.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.TimeSpan%29> constructor. If this parameter is not explicitly initialized in a constructor call, its value is <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName>.
When the exception is thrown by the regular expression engine, the value of the <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexMatchTimeoutException.Input%2A> property reflects the entire input string passed to the regular expression engine. It does not reflect a partial string, such as the substring that the engine searches in the call to a method such as <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex.Match%28System.String%2CSystem.Int32%29?displayProperty=fullName>.

Docs.summary: Gets the time-out interval for a regular expression match.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property reflects the value of the `matchTimeout` parameter of the <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexMatchTimeoutException.%23ctor%28System.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.TimeSpan%29> constructor. If the parameter is not properly initialized in a constructor call, its value is `Timespan.FromTicks(-1)`.
The value of this property reflects the time-out interval set in the call to the <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex> constructor or static method. It does not reflect the exact interval that has elapsed from the beginning of the method call to the time the exception is thrown.

Docs.summary: Gets the regular expression pattern that was used in the matching operation when the time-out occurred.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property reflects the value of the `regexPattern` parameter of the <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexMatchTimeoutException.%23ctor%28System.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.TimeSpan%29> constructor. If the parameter is not properly initialized in a constructor call, its value is <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName>.

Docs.param: The object to populate with data.
Docs.summary: Populates a object with the data needed to serialize a object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Text.RegularExpressions.RegexMatchTimeoutException> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable> interface object.
Any objects that are included in the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo> object are automatically tracked and serialized by the formatter.
